alert.note: Alert for Catoosa; Dade; Murray; Walker; Whitfield (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 5:13PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Catoosa, northeastern Murray, Whitfield, southern Walker and south central Dade Counties through 545 PM EST... At 513 PM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Red Clay State Park to Beaumont to near Sulpher Springs, and moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...40 mph wind and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Dalton, Lafayette, Ringgold, Varnell, Tunnel Hill, Cohutta, La Fayette, Naomi, Sumac, Noble, Wood Station, Rocky Face, Gregory, Tennga, Mill Creek, Linwood, Beaumont, Beaverdale, Dawnville and Villanow. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
